metadata.name: FACT_BLOCKS
metadata.comment: This table contains block level data for the Polygon Blockchain. This table can be used to analyze trends at a block level, for example gas fees vs. total transactions over time. For more information on EVM transactions, please see [Etherscan Resources](https://etherscan.io/directory/Learning_Resources/Ethereum) or [The Ethereum Organization](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/blocks/)

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

NETWORK.name: NETWORK
NETWORK.comment: The network on the blockchain used by a transaction.

BLOCKCHAIN.name: BLOCKCHAIN
BLOCKCHAIN.comment: The blockchain on which transactions are being confirmed.

TX_COUNT.name: TX_COUNT
TX_COUNT.comment: Total number of transactions within a block.

DIFFICULTY.name: DIFFICULTY
DIFFICULTY.comment: The effort required to mine the block.

TOTAL_DIFFICULTY.name: TOTAL_DIFFICULTY
TOTAL_DIFFICULTY.comment: Total difficulty of the chain at a given block.

EXTRA_DATA.name: EXTRA_DATA
EXTRA_DATA.comment: Any data included by the validator for a given block.

GAS_LIMIT.name: GAS_LIMIT
GAS_LIMIT.comment: Total gas limit provided by all transactions in the block.

GAS_USED.name: GAS_USED
GAS_USED.comment: Total gas used in the block.

HASH.name: HASH
HASH.comment: The hash of the block header for a given block.

PARENT_HASH.name: PARENT_HASH
PARENT_HASH.comment: The hash of the block from which a given block is generated. Also known as the parent block.

RECEIPTS_ROOT.name: RECEIPTS_ROOT
RECEIPTS_ROOT.comment: The root of the state trie.

SHA3_UNCLES.name: SHA3_UNCLES
SHA3_UNCLES.comment: The mechanism which Ethereum Javascript RLP encodes an empty string.

SIZE.name: SIZE
SIZE.comment: Block size, which is determined by a given block's gas limit.

UNCLE_BLOCKS.name: UNCLE_BLOCKS
UNCLE_BLOCKS.comment: Uncle blocks occur when two blocks are mined and broadcasted at the same time, with the same block number. The block validated across the most nodes will be added to the primary chain, and the other one becomes an uncle block. Miners do receive rewards for uncle blocks.

BLOCK_HEADER_JSON.name: BLOCK_HEADER_JSON
BLOCK_HEADER_JSON.comment: This JSON column contains the block header details.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: FACT_EVENT_LOGS
metadata.comment: This table contains flattened event logs from transactions on the Polygon Blockchain. Transactions may have multiple events, which are denoted by the event index for a transaction hash. Therefore, this table is unique on the combination of transaction hash and event index. Event names are decoded in this table where possible. The event inputs column will contain the log details in JSON format. Specific fields can be pulled from this column using the following sample format: ```event_inputs:<FILED_NAME>::<DATA TYPE> as <FIELD_NAME>```.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed. This field will not be unique in this table, as a given transaction can include multiple events.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of this transaction.

ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The from address of this transaction.

ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.name: ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS
ORIGIN_TO_ADDRESS.comment: The to address of this transaction.

CONTRACT_ADDRESS.name: CONTRACT_ADDRESS
CONTRACT_ADDRESS.comment: The address interacted with for a given event.

CONTRACT_NAME.name: CONTRACT_NAME
CONTRACT_NAME.comment: The name of the contract or token, where possible.

EVENT_NAME.name: EVENT_NAME
EVENT_NAME.comment: The decoded event name for a given event.

EVENT_INPUTS.name: EVENT_INPUTS
EVENT_INPUTS.comment: The decoded event inputs for a given event.

EVENT_REMOVED.name: EVENT_REMOVED
EVENT_REMOVED.comment: Whether the event has been removed from the transaction.

_LOG_ID.name: _LOG_ID
_LOG_ID.comment: This is the primary key for this table. This is a concatenation of the transaction hash and the event index at which the event occurred.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

clustering_key.label: Clustering Key
clustering_key.description: The key used to cluster this table

row_count.label: Row Count
row_count.description: An approximate count of rows in this table

bytes.label: Approximate Size
bytes.description: Approximate size of the table as reported by Snowflake

metadata.name: FACT_TRACES
metadata.comment: This table contains flattened trace data for internal contract calls on the Polygon Blockchain. Hex encoded fields can be decoded to integers by using `polygon.public.udf_hex_to_int()`.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: The transaction hash for the trace. Please note, this is not necessarily unique in this table as transactions frequently have multiple traces.

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: The block number of this transaction.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The block timestamp of this transaction.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The sending address of this trace. This is not necessarily the from address of the transaction.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: The receiving address of this trace. This is not necessarily the to address of the transaction.

MATIC_VALUE.name: MATIC_VALUE
MATIC_VALUE.comment: The amount of MATIC transferred in this trace.

GAS.name: GAS
GAS.comment: The gas supplied for this trace.

GAS_USED.name: GAS_USED
GAS_USED.comment: The gas used for this trace.

INPUT.name: INPUT
INPUT.comment: The input data for this trace.

OUTPUT.name: OUTPUT
OUTPUT.comment: The output data for this trace.

TYPE.name: TYPE
TYPE.comment: The type of internal transaction. Common trace types are `CALL`, `DELEGATECALL`, and `STATICCALL`.

IDENTIFIER.name: IDENTIFIER
IDENTIFIER.comment: This field represents the position and type of the trace within the transaction.

DATA.name: DATA
DATA.comment: The raw JSON data for this trace.

SUB_TRACES.name: SUB_TRACES
SUB_TRACES.comment: The amount of nested sub traces for this trace.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: FACT_TRANSACTIONS
metadata.comment: This table contains transaction level data for the Polygon Blockchain. Each transaction will have a unique transaction hash, along with transactions fees and a MATIC value transferred when applicable. Transactions may be native MATIC transfers or interactions with contract addresses. For more information, please see [The Ethereum Organization - Transactions](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/transactions/)

BLOCK_NUMBER.name: BLOCK_NUMBER
BLOCK_NUMBER.comment: Also known as block height. The block number, which indicates the length of the blockchain, increases after the addition of each new block.

BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.name: BLOCK_TIMESTAMP
BLOCK_TIMESTAMP.comment: The date and time at which the block was produced.

BLOCK_HASH.name: BLOCK_HASH
BLOCK_HASH.comment: Block hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generate when a block is produced.

TX_HASH.name: TX_HASH
TX_HASH.comment: Transaction hash is a unique 66-character identifier that is generated when a transaction is executed.

NONCE.name: NONCE
NONCE.comment: The number of transactions sent from a given address.

POSITION.name: POSITION
POSITION.comment: The position of the transaction within the block.

ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.name: ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE
ORIGIN_FUNCTION_SIGNATURE.comment: The function signature of the contract call.

FROM_ADDRESS.name: FROM_ADDRESS
FROM_ADDRESS.comment: The sending address of this transaction.

TO_ADDRESS.name: TO_ADDRESS
TO_ADDRESS.comment: The receiving address of this transaction. This can be a contract address.

TX_FEE.name: TX_FEE
TX_FEE.comment: Amount paid to validate the transaction in MATIC.

GAS_PRICE.name: GAS_PRICE
GAS_PRICE.comment: Cost per unit of gas in Gwei.

GAS_LIMIT.name: GAS_LIMIT
GAS_LIMIT.comment: Maximum amount of gas allocated for the transaction.

CUMULATIVE_GAS_USED.name: CUMULATIVE_GAS_USED
CUMULATIVE_GAS_USED.comment: The total amount of gas used when this transaction was executed in the block.

INPUT_DATA.name: INPUT_DATA
INPUT_DATA.comment: This column contains additional data for this transaction, and is commonly used as part of a contract interaction or as a message to the recipient.

TX_JSON.name: TX_JSON
TX_JSON.comment: This JSON column contains the transaction details, including event logs.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

clustering_key.label: Clustering Key
clustering_key.description: The key used to cluster this table

row_count.description: An approximate count of rows in this table

bytes.label: Approximate Size
bytes.description: Approximate size of the table as reported by Snowflake
